oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Eddie Hill Show (Tape 4)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This recording features a conversation between radio host, Eddie Hill and Hank Snow. Red Foley and Roy Acuff call in but the conversation is one-sided and only Hill and Snow's side of the conversation can be heard. The recording includes the two discussing Snow's life, career, and music. Hill does announce songs that were played in real time but are not included on this recording. The tape is dated April of 1957. This tape is the fourth for the Eddie Hill Show and conversation has been carried over from the third tape. This tape is forty-seven of an unidentified number of tapes.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Eddie Hill; Hank Snow; Red Foley; Roy Acuff;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Eddie Hill announcing upcoming shows [Hank Snow talking in the background] [conversation continues from tape 3] -- (03:26) Opry Star Spotlight program begins -- (03:35) Hill and Snow figure out what went wrong with the turntables -- (4:06) Hill begins talking to Red Foley who is on the wire [periods of silence and one-sided conversation as Hill listens and talks to Foley on the phone] -- (09:18) Sally Sweet joins the conversation and Hill and Snow talk to her [one-sided conversation, can only hear Hill and Snow] -- (12:09) Hill says goodbye to Foley -- (13:21) Hill announces next song -- (13:34) Hill and Snow talk about the song "That Crazy Mambo Thing" -- (14:23) Hill and Snow talk about the song, "My Arabian Baby" -- (15:36) Roy Acuff calls in [periods of silence and one-sided conversation] -- (16:12) Hill repeats that Acuff is thankful that Foley is still listening and to say hi for him -- (16:39) One-sided conversation continues -- (18:53) Hill says goodbye to Acuff -- (18:56) Hill relays what Acuff said about how great Foley is and Snow adds how great all the country artists are -- (19:37) Snow relays Foley's message to tell Roy and Ernest hello -- (19:58) Hill announces next song -- (20:34) Hill and Snow talks about how Snow "sings closer to his guitar that anyone" and how Snow tunes his guitar -- (21:35) Snow and Hill start to talk about Snow's travels -- (21:46) Snow goes back to talk about the bear story that the Foleys had mentioned during their phone call -- (23:57) Snow talks about life after Dallas, Texas and starting with the Grand Ole Opry -- (25:13) The two begin talking about Snow's son Jimmy -- (26:16) Snow shares the story about how Jimmy was born in the Salvation Army hospital -- (28:08) The two discuss how Snow could give back to the Salvation Army -- (30:32) The two begin to talk about Snow's mother [conversation and tape cut out]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Snow, Hank; Hill, Eddie, 1921-1994; Hill, Eddie, 1921-1995; Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Foley, Red's Family Members; Acuff, Roy;
